text:
There are many different types of testing that you can use to make sure your code is working as expected. 

Match the tiers of testing to the correct definition

answers.text: Measuring the latency or throughput of your application or service.
Tests if the application or system can recover from crashes and how well it recovers.
Testing for known vulnerabilities in your service or application.
Testing whether the product/software is accessible and usable for everyone, including people with a wide range of disabilities.
Tests that check basic functionality of the application.
Tests if the combined modules work together or not.
Tests that focus on the business requirements of an application.
Testing each component or module of your software
Formal tests executed to verify if a system satisfies its business requirements.
Testing for user friendliness.
Assessing and mitigating privacy risks in the product.
Testing your application or service under higher and higher load.

text: Is the following statement true or false. "You need to preform more integration testing than unit testing".
Which of the following is true about automated tests? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Executes test scripts that have been written in advance
The quality of the tests depend on how much the tests cover
The quality of the tests depend on how well the scripts have been written

text: Is the following statement true or false "Manual testing is completed in person by navigating through the application or interacting with the software".
Performance testing covers which of the following? (Select all that are applicable).
Fill in the blank to complete the statement  "Automated testing is ____________ expensive than manual testing".

Is the following statement true or false “An example of the difference between integration testing and functional testing is that a functional test may simply verify that you can query the database while an integration test would get a specific value from the database as defined by the product requirements.”
Is the following statement true or false “End-to-end testing replicates a user behaviour with the software in a complete application environment and verifies that various user flows work as expected”
Which of the following are true for testing? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Larger modules contain the most defects
The cost of fixing a bug decreases if the bug is found later in the development lifecycle
Test cases should be reviewed and updated on a regular basis

text:
Software testing is generally classified into two main broad categories: functional testing and non-functional testing. 

Match the following to the correct category of testing.

answers.text: Unit Testing
Performance Testing
Security Testing
Load Testing
Integration Testing
White Box and Black Box Testing
Stress Testing
Disaster Recovery Testing
Sanity Testing
Usability Testing
Scalability Testing

text: Which of the following are responsibilities of a Test Analyst? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Decides what to test and how.
Tests software to detect bugs and errors
Prepares test strategy and defines the scope of work.

text: Software testing teams use a wide range of tools to support the day to day work.  Which of the following are tools that may be used by a software testing team? (Select all that are applicable).
Based on the Week 7 lecture 'Test Management' what is the purpose of 'Stress Testing'?

answers.answer_text: Modelling the expected usage of a software  program by simulating multiple users accessing  the program concurrently.
Stressing the system to breaking point to determine  whether the breakdown is potentially harmful.
None of the options are correct.
Exposing problems such as memory leaks or  stack overflows.

text: Based on the Week 7 lecture 'Test Management' match the definitions and descriptions to the correct test type.

answers.text: To ensure that each component behaves  ‘correctly’.
To ensure that the user requirements  have been met.
To test system performance under maximum expected load.
To ensure that system is stable over extended period.
To test interaction between related components.
Compares system functionality against agreed-on user requirements
Carried out by client using scenarios, supervised by developer.
Focuses on interfaces between components.
Simulates key processes under maximum load.
Focuses on usual business processes, and normal workflow.
Load increased until system fails. Checks effects of over-load.
Uses white-box testing to check each program function fully.

text: Based on the Week 7 lecture 'Test Management' what are some problems of testing?

answers.answer_text: Performance testing had not anticipated the level of user load.
The functionality of the system had been tested, but not under load.
Nobody knew that the system would fail completely under pressure.
